=







Yea... it actually took three nights to build the original structure=
.. then, LATER ON, all the complicated Nice-ities were added..
=A0
=A0But t=
he actuall "battle ready fort" was done in three nights.
=A0
=A0=A0=A0=A0=
=A0=A0 In the city of Konan, there is a Maeno family document which reveals=
 alot about the Hachisuka, Maeno, Toyotomi, and Oda=A0Nobunaga which is not=
 recorded in other records....
=A0
..... might be worth looking into. Again=
, it contradicts some "accepted history"... so fair warning.=A0 For example=
, it says that Toyotomi was actually working as a spy for the Hachisuka in =
the beginning--- that he was not a peasant at all, but a low ranking samura=
i working as a spy. He was hired by the Ikoma Family and it was Ikoma's dau=
gher that introduce Toyotomi to Oda Nobunaga.
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 He worked =
with the Hachisuka and Maeno later on as a combination of soldier/spy. .. i=
n fact, many of the samurai families from the upper Owari area (the Hachisu=
ka, Fukushima, Kawajiri, Kumazawa, Nojiri, Nakagawa, Maeno=A0etc.etc) of no=
rthern Nagoya, Ichinomiya, Konan, etc.etc---- most of their family history =
follows the "spy" version of the story--- not the "peasant" version..but th=
en again, these families are known to have been spies themselves-- - so I g=
uess that it makes sense.
=A0
=A0So, it is worth looking into to get a very=
 different look on it all.
